samples.current_output: Yes! Government hospitals = Free treatment for all. Free services: 1) OPD consultation, 2) Basic tests (blood, urine, X-ray), 3) Medicines (available stock), 4) Surgery (non-cosmetic), 5) Emergency care, 6) Delivery, 7) Vaccinations. Paid: Special rooms, specific tests (MRI/CT in some), outside medicines. Quality: Varies - GH Chennai, Madurai Medical College = good facilities.

NO! Most antibiotics = Schedule H - prescription mandatory. Reason: Antibiotic resistance is serious health threat. Pharmacy violation: Drug Inspector complaint, license action. Exception: Some topical antibiotics (creams) may be OTC. Good practice: Complete prescribed course, don't share antibiotics, don't use leftover. Doctor: Can prescribe over phone in genuine emergency.

samples.instruction: Advance directive for mental health endraal enna?
samples.current_output: Advance directive = When mentally well, write down treatment preferences for future crisis. Includes: 1) Preferred treatment methods, 2) Treatments to avoid, 3) Nominated representative, 4) Hospital preferences, 5) ECT consent/refusal. How: Register with Mental Health Review Board. Benefits: Your wishes respected even when unable to communicate. Can modify when competent. Legal document.

Waiting period: Usually 2-4 years (policy varies). Pre-existing = condition before policy started. Rules: 1) Must declare at proposal, 2) Non-disclosure = claim rejection + policy cancellation, 3) After waiting period, fully covered, 4) IRDAI: Max 4 years waiting period. Tip: Disclose honestly, buy policy early when healthy, continuous renewal maintains benefits.

samples.instruction: Wrong side surgery (wrong leg, wrong kidney) - legal action?
samples.current_output: Serious negligence! "Never event" in medical terms. Action: 1) Document immediately (photos, records), 2) Consumer Forum - high compensation, 3) Criminal case (Section 338), 4) Medical Council complaint. Protocols violated: WHO surgical safety checklist. Hospitals have: Marking protocols, time-out procedures. Failure = gross negligence. Compensation: Significant damages awarded in such cases.

samples.instruction: Doctor enga native language-la explain pannanumaa?
samples.current_output: Yes! Right to information in understandable language. Includes: 1) Diagnosis explanation, 2) Treatment options, 3) Risks and benefits, 4) Consent form explanation, 5) Medicine instructions. If doctor doesn't speak Tamil: Hospital should arrange translator. Written materials: Should be in local language. Complaint: If communication barrier causes harm - negligence claim possible.

samples.current_output: 6 months joint pain - orthopedic consultation needed. Tests: 1) X-ray first (usually sufficient), 2) MRI if X-ray normal but pain persists, 3) Blood tests (RA, uric acid). Government: Orthopedic OPD - free consultation and basic tests. Common causes: Osteoarthritis (wear and tear), rheumatoid arthritis. Treatment: 1) Medicines, 2) Physiotherapy (free at government), 3) Joint replacement if severe (CMCHIS covers). Self-care: Weight control, walking, avoid squatting.

Legal, but verify. Check: 1) Company registration, 2) Nurse/attendant credentials, 3) Doctor supervision (for nursing care), 4) Agreement/contract terms, 5) Emergency protocols, 6) Insurance/liability coverage. Services: Nursing care, physiotherapy, doctor visits, sample collection. Caution: Verify ID of persons coming home. Complaint: If fraud/negligence - police + Consumer Forum.

Free options: 1) Government Yoga centres (every district), 2) AYUSH hospitals - yoga unit, 3) Parks - morning free sessions (many cities), 4) Schools/colleges - yoga programs. Paid: 1) Private yoga studios, 2) Art of Living, Isha centres, 3) Online courses (after basics learned). Certification: If want to teach - AYUSH certified courses. Therapy: For specific conditions - consult yoga therapist (BNYS or certified).

samples.instruction: Golden hour à®à®©à¯à®±à®¾à®²à¯ à®à®©à¯à®©? à®…à®¤à¯à®² hospital à®ªà¯‹à®•à®£à¯à®®à®¾?
samples.current_output: Golden hour = First 60 minutes after trauma/heart attack. Critical because: 1) Brain damage starts in minutes without oxygen, 2) Bleeding control crucial, 3) Heart attack - early treatment = more heart saved, 4) Trauma - internal bleeding stops. Action: 1) Call 108 immediately, 2) Don't move spine injury victims, 3) CPR if no pulse (if trained), 4) Control visible bleeding. Nearest hospital first - don't travel far.

Challenges: Expensive, not always available in India. Options: 1) Government policy: Free treatment for some rare diseases (up to Rs.50 lakhs), 2) Crowdfunding platforms, 3) Pharma company compassionate access programs, 4) Import license for unavailable drugs, 5) Clinical trials. Centers: AIIMS, CMC Vellore have rare disease programs. Apply: Through treating hospital's rare disease cell.

samples.instruction: Siddha medicine-la heavy metals irukkumaa? Safe-aa?
samples.current_output: Some Siddha medicines use: Metals (Paashanam), mercury (Rasam), arsenic (Paadaanam) - after purification (Suththi). Licensed products: Processed as per traditional methods, tested for safety limits. Risk: Unregulated products, improper preparation. Safety: 1) Buy only licensed products, 2) Consult qualified doctor, 3) Inform if taking other medicines, 4) Follow dosage strictly. Research: CCRS validates safety of traditional preparations.

CMCHIS = Free health insurance for TN families. Coverage: Rs.5 lakh per family per year. Eligibility: Annual income below Rs.72,000 (rice card holders automatic). Benefits: 1,027 procedures covered - surgeries, treatments, follow-up. Cashless treatment at empanelled hospitals. Card: Family smart card issued. Renewal: Automatic for eligible families.

samples.instruction: Insurance claim reject aanaal enna seivathu?
samples.current_output: Rejection reasons: 1) Pre-existing disease (waiting period), 2) Excluded treatment, 3) Document missing, 4) Non-network hospital, 5) Fraud suspected. Appeal: 1) Written grievance to insurer (30 days), 2) IRDAI IGMS portal, 3) Insurance Ombudsman (free, up to Rs.30 lakhs), 4) Consumer Forum. Success tip: Get rejection reason in writing, provide complete documents, cite policy terms.

Siddha for Swasakasam (respiratory): Asthma, bronchitis, allergic rhinitis, sinusitis. Medicines: 1) Thalisathi Choornam, 2) Adathodai Kudineer, 3) Kantharasam, 4) Poorna Chandrodayam. Therapies: 1) Steam inhalation with herbs, 2) Nasiyam (nasal drops), 3) Chest application with specific oils. Preventive: Build immunity, avoid triggers. Works well: For chronic management, reducing frequency of attacks.

samples.instruction: Hospital bill à®ªà¯à®°à®¿à®¯à®², itemized bill à®•à¯‡à®Ÿà¯à®•à®²à®¾à®®à®¾?
samples.current_output: Yes! Right to detailed bill. Must include: 1) Room charges (per day), 2) Doctor fees, 3) Surgery/procedure charges, 4) Medicines (with MRP), 5) Consumables, 6) Lab tests, 7) Nursing charges, 8) Any other charges. Hospital must provide: Written estimate before admission (planned), final itemized bill. Overcharging: Consumer Forum complaint. Compare: Check medicine MRP, verify tests done.

Assessment: 1) Child psychiatrist, 2) Developmental pediatrician, 3) Clinical psychologist. Government: 1) Institute of Child Health (Chennai), 2) District Early Intervention Centres (DEIC), 3) Medical college child psychiatry. Services: Diagnosis, therapy (occupational, speech, behavioral), medicines if needed. Free: Government facilities. Schools: Special needs provisions mandatory. UDID: Apply for benefits if certified.

Mental Healthcare Act 2017 rights: 1) Access to mental healthcare, 2) Community-based treatment (not just hospitals), 3) Informed consent, 4) Confidentiality, 5) No discrimination, 6) Humane treatment, 7) Legal aid, 8) Complaint mechanism, 9) Advance directive right. Government duty: Provide affordable mental healthcare. Insurance: Must cover mental illness like physical illness.

Challenge options: 1) Second opinion from forensic expert, 2) Exhumation and re-autopsy (court order needed), 3) Cross-examination of autopsy doctor, 4) Expert witness contradiction. Grounds: 1) Incomplete examination, 2) Wrong conclusions, 3) Procedural violations, 4) Bias. Important: Video recording of autopsy now mandatory in many cases. Evidence: Preserve body photos if possible.

samples.instruction: Dr. Muthulakshmi Maternity Benefit Scheme enna?
samples.current_output: TN government scheme: Rs.18,000 cash assistance. Eligibility: 1) TN resident, 2) Family income limit, 3) First two live births, 4) Institutional delivery, 5) Age 19+. Payment: 3 installments - during pregnancy, after delivery, after vaccination completion. Apply: PHC/Government hospital during registration. Documents: Ration card, Aadhar, bank account. Working women: Separate maternity benefit also applicable.

Possible with precautions! Important: 1) Inform BOTH doctors about all medicines, 2) Gap of 30-60 minutes between different system medicines, 3) Some interactions possible, 4) Don't stop allopathy suddenly for chronic diseases. Integration: Many hospitals practice integrated medicine. Best: Consult at integrated AYUSH-allopathy clinics. Examples: Diabetes, BP - can take both under supervision. Never self-combine without medical advice.

samples.instruction: Suicidal thoughts irukku - yaarai contact panradhu?
samples.current_output: Helplines (24x7): 1) iCall: 9152987821, 2) Vandrevala Foundation: 1860-2662-345, 3) AASRA: 9820466726, 4) Snehi: 044-24640050 (Chennai), 5) NIMHANS: 080-46110007. Immediate danger: Call 108 or go to nearest hospital emergency. Talk to: Trusted family/friend. Remember: Feelings are temporary, help is available. Professional help: Psychiatrist can help with treatment.

Rights: 1) Completely voluntary - no forced sterilization, 2) Informed consent mandatory, 3) Cooling-off period before surgery, 4) Minimum age 22 (women), 21 (men). Compensation: TN scheme - cash incentive after surgery. Complications: Government covers treatment, additional compensation. Failure: Pregnancy after sterilization - compensation scheme exists. Never sign blank forms - read consent fully.

Yes! TN Siddha infrastructure: 1) Government Siddha Medical Colleges - Palayamkottai, Tirunelveli (oldest), 2) District AYUSH hospitals - Every district, 3) Taluk level Siddha dispensaries, 4) PHC attached Siddha units. Major colleges: Tirunelveli, Chennai (2), Palani. All services free. Find: tnhealth.tn.gov.in or AYUSH department website. Total: 100+ government Siddha facilities in TN.

samples.instruction: Siddha doctor qualification enna? Verify eppadi?
samples.current_output: Qualification: BSMS (Bachelor of Siddha Medicine and Surgery) - 5.5 years. Higher: MD (Siddha). Registration: State Medical Council mandatory. Verify: 1) TN Siddha Medical Council register, 2) Display of registration certificate, 3) BSMS degree certificate. Unqualified practice: Report to council, police. Titles: Siddha Maruthuvam, Vaidhiyar - verify registration before consulting.
